text.0: like heaven art thou one form is bright one holy like day and night dissimilar in colour.
text.1: all magic powers thou aidest selfdepen dent auspicious be thy bounty here o pūṣan.
text.2: goatborne the guard of cattle he whose home is strength inspirer of the hymn set over all the world.
text.3: brandishing here and there his lightly moving goad beholding every creature pūṣan god goes forth.
text.4: o pūṣan with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean in the airs midregion.
text.5: thou goest on an embassy to sūrya subdued by love desirous of the glory.
text.6: near kinsman of the heaven and earth is pūṣan liberal lord of food of wondrous iustre.
text.7: whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving subdued by love the deities gave to sūrya.
